intro: Arenaria fendleri var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its smooth, glabrous leaves distinguish it from other varieties of Arenaria fendleri.
